comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Marshall Hall was a dancer and pantomimist in his early career. See Palm Beach Daily News - Feb 25, 1938 for a bio. See How to Develop Your ESP. Susy Smith, page 127 books.google.com/books?id=p0F0EJ6St8kC&pg=PT127&l... for a bit of biographical information along with a report of an experience he had with a ouija board.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: M. Hall seemed to have esoteric preferences, The Sun and the New York herald., March 28, 1920, Section 4, Page 7, col. 3 "AMERICAN DANCER'S MATINEE" reportet that he "will give a matinee at the Harris Theatre on Friday afternoon, April 9, In which he will present several psychic dances representative of the former incarnations which he believes he has had In Egypt, India, Peru, China, France and even on Mars. His impersonations will attempt to portray his existence in ten supposedly earlier lives."

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A dancer named Melba Procter is mentioned in Boston Evening Transcript - 6. Mai 1914, "FEATURES AT BUTLER FESTIVAL - Young and Old Will Participate in Dances at Mechanics Building". There was a Melba Procter, exhibitor and breeder of Pomeranians, see photo from 1922 in fultonhistory.com/Newspapers%2021/Jamaica%20NY%20Daily%20..., see also mysite.verizon.net/res8w765/id66.html, but I'm not sure that this is the same person.
